channel.title: SkyLearn RSS Test A – Property + Football Mixed Feed
channel.description: Feed containing a balanced mix of property and football stories for pre-filter validation

item.title: Cushman & Wakefield relocates London headquarters to Broadgate Tower
item.description: The global real-estate advisor has moved its UK base to 20 Primrose Street, occupying 180,000 sq ft across six floors.

item.title: GPE secures new lease with media firm at Rathbone Square
item.description: Great Portland Estates has signed a 10-year lease with a creative agency taking 45,000 sq ft in Fitzrovia.

item.title: HSBC consolidates Birmingham offices into one regional hub
item.description: HSBC UK will relocate 1,500 employees to Arena Central as part of its Midlands workplace optimisation programme.

item.title: Arsenal thrash Chelsea 4-1 to close gap at top of Premier League
item.description: Goals from Saka, Ødegaard and Martinelli sealed a dominant win at Emirates Stadium.

item.title: Manchester United confirms Ten Hag contract extension until 2028
item.description: The club said the manager’s new deal reflects progress in domestic and European competitions.

item.title: Liverpool announce plans for global pre-season tour in Asia 2026
item.description: Jürgen Klopp’s side will play matches in Tokyo, Seoul and Bangkok as part of their summer preparations.

item.title: Landsec opens new flexible workspace hub in Victoria
item.description: Landsec has launched a 120,000 sq ft flexible office at Nova Place, designed for hybrid tenants seeking shorter lease terms.

item.title: British Land pre-lets space at Canada Water to tech startup
item.description: The developer has secured a pre-let with an AI software company taking 25,000 sq ft at The Dock Shed.

item.title: SEGRO expands logistics park portfolio with new site in Park Royal
item.description: SEGRO has acquired 15 acres in west London to develop a new urban logistics hub targeting last-mile operators.

item.title: Tottenham set to unveil £60m training complex expansion
item.description: The new facility in Enfield will include two indoor pitches and a player recovery centre.

item.title: Newcastle United announce record commercial revenues for 2025
item.description: The club reported £320m turnover driven by sponsorship growth and Champions League participation.

item.title: England to host 2028 UEFA Nations League Finals
item.description: Wembley Stadium will stage the semi-finals and final next June, marking another major tournament return.

item.title: Brookfield starts new office development near Liverpool Street
item.description: Brookfield Properties has broken ground on a 200,000 sq ft Grade A office tower designed to target ESG-conscious occupiers.

item.title: Derwent London lets final floors at The Featherstone Building
item.description: The developer confirmed full occupancy after securing leases with two fintech companies for 35,000 sq ft combined.

item.title: Canary Wharf Group launches new life sciences campus at North Quay
item.description: The project will deliver 750,000 sq ft of laboratory and research space aimed at biotech tenants.

item.title: Crystal Palace confirm stadium expansion plans approved by council
item.description: Selhurst Park will gain 8,000 extra seats following planning approval, with work starting next spring.

item.title: Everton appoints new sporting director ahead of January window
item.description: Former Wolves executive Matt Hobbs joins to oversee recruitment strategy as the club targets mid-table stability.

item.title: FA launches £25m investment in grassroots football facilities
item.description: The initiative will fund new 3G pitches and refurbishments across 200 UK community clubs.
